pullRequest.title: Refactor support for Sync to work with MongoDB Realm
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR refactors the old Sync API's to work against MongoDB Realm:
Noticeable changes:


SyncManager has been refactored. All functionality related to connections or auth has moved to RealmApp or RealmAppConfiguration. So only remaining functionality is purely Sync specific. It is now something you access under RealmApp. Note: This API is still very much work-in-progress, and it hasn't been aligned with the other SDK's yet. So any input on it would be nice. ObjectStore still only allows one Sync Client to exist, so right now there is a bit of a hacky check to make sure this doesn't happen. We should probably evaluate exactly how to do this.


I would like to rename SyncManager to SyncService to better fit with the service concept in Stitch, but name is still up in the air. The renaming has been left out of this PR to avoid it growing to big.


We no longer need callbacks to get the access token. The one provided by the user object is sufficient. It only needs to be valid when creating the sync configuration. After that, the server handles it. This cleans up a lot of code in SyncManager/SyncSession.


Creating Sync configurations have been reverted to the old pattern of manually creating the config through a builder. This makes it yet again more similar to how local Realms are created. The other SDK's are reverting to this as well.


Added a SyncConfiguration.default(user, partionValue) to make it as easy to create a new config. This API is still very much experiemental.


Defining proxy settings (headers, authorization header) have moved to RealmAppConfiguration.


Example of API usage
// Configure App
val config = RealmAppConfiguration.Builder("app-id")
  .authorizationHeader("customHeaderName")
  .addCustomHeader("customName", "customValue")
  .appName("MyApp")
  .appVersion("1.0") 
  .build()
val app = RealmApp(config)

// Open Realm
val user = app.login(RealmCredentials.anonymous())
val syncConfig = SyncConfiguration.Builder(user, "partion-value").build()
val defaultConfig = SyncConfiguration.defaultConfig(user, "partion-value")

val realm = Realm.getInstance(synConfig)

// Kotlin
val session: SyncSession = realm.syncSession; 
// Java
SyncSession  session = app.getSyncService().getSession(realmConfig);

// Other Sync functionality
val syncService: SyncService = app.syncService
val sessions: List<SyncSession> = syncService.allSessions // Get all sessions
syncService.refreshConnections() // Reset all sessions

Open Question

Name of SyncManager?  Should it be public at all or should functionality be elsewhere?
Should ConnectionListeners remain on SyncSession or move to SyncManager?
